description: From Latin subreptio, from subripere, subreptum (“to snatch or take away secretly”). Compare French subreption. See surreptitious, surreptition.

entries.meaning: The act of obtaining a favour by surprise, or by unfair representation through suppression or fraudulent concealment of facts.
examples: lest there should be any subreption in this sacred business, it is ordered, that these Ordinations should be no other than solemn
